business.headline: India on track to achieve 500 GW renewable energy target by 2030: Pralhad JoshiJoshi said investor interest in India's renewable sector has been strong, with over $145 billion invested in the past 10 years, including $20 billion in foreign direct investment.
HCLTech CEO explains how AI is reshaping IT jobs and revenuesVijayakumar said the global business environment has been turbulent over the past few years, but things now appear to be stabilising.

Børge Brende to India Today: 'The Ukraine war possibly could end this year' after four yearsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende joins India Today's Rajdeep Sardesai at Davos to discuss the most complex geopolitical landscape since 1945. Brende highlights that despite global tensions, including potential friction between Europe and the US over Greenland, global growth remains resilient at over 3%. He notes that 'the Ukraine war possibly could end this year' if there is sufficient willingness for a solution. The discussion covers India's rising economic influence, with Brende describing India as a 'US$10 trillion economy pretty soon' that contributes 20% to global growth. He addresses the 'Trumpian world order,' suggesting that while media focuses on the 'noise,' quiet bilateral cooperation continues to drive the global agenda. Brende identifies escalating conflict in the Gulf, debt bubbles, and 'black swan' events like cyber warfare as the primary risks to global stability in 2026. He emphasizes that the WEF remains an impartial platform where competing powers like the US, China, and India can engage in essential dialogue.
IMF Hikes India's GDP Growth Estimate to 7.3% for 2025-26The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has revised India's GDP growth estimate for the financial year 2025-26 upward to 7.3 percent.

RBI proposes linking BRICS digital currencies to ease cross-border trade: ReportIf accepted, it would mark the first formal attempt to link the central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) of BRICS members, a move that could reduce dependence on the US dollar at a time of heightened geopolitical tensions.

Global trade moving towards mini-lateral and plurilateral deals, says WEF's Kimberley BotwrightGlobal trade is entering a new phase, with countries moving away from broad multilateral agreements and increasingly turning to smaller, targeted trade deals, says Kimberley Botwright.

Sensex tanks over 300 points, Nifty tumbles amid global uncertaintyThe Sensex fell more than 300 points, while the Nifty slipped below the crucial 25,600 mark as investors remained cautious through the session.

India can strike trade deals on its own terms, says WEF chief Borge BrendeBorge Brende said that India's rise over the past few years has reshaped its leverage in the global economy, giving New Delhi far more room to decide when and with whom it wants to sign trade deals.

IMF lifts India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.3% amid global uncertaintyIn its latest World Economic Outlook report, the IMF said India's economy is now expected to grow by 7.3% in FY26, up 0.7 percentage points from its earlier estimate. The upgrade reflects better-than-expected growth in the third quarter and continued strength in the fourth quarter of the current fiscal year.

Can Budget 2026 deliver scale, skills and digital growth for manufacturing?Budget 2026 is expected to play a key role in shaping the future of India's manufacturing sector. From expanding scale to building skilled manpower and driving digital adoption, the industry has clear expectations from the government.

Taxes, jobs, credit policies: What consumers can expect from Budget 2026Budget 2026 is expected to touch everyday finances, from how much tax people pay to how easily they can access credit. Consumers are hoping for measures that ease costs and support stable income growth.

From ruin to reform: My 12-year real estate nightmare and why RERA is a lifelineA decade-long struggle through stalled projects reveals why strong regulation matters. RERA restored accountability in a sector where delays were normal and buyers carried all the risk.

Shadowfax Technologies IPO opens tomorrow: Check price, GMP and other detailsShadowfax Technologies is set to enter the primary market tomorrow with its much-watched IPO. The issue comes at a time when online shopping and same-day delivery services are seeing steady growth across India.

Silver crosses Rs 3 lakh per kg for first time: What's driving the rally?Silve price today: The rate for 10 grams of silver stood at Rs 3,180 in Chennai, Hyderabad and Kerala. In Mumbai, Delhi, Kolkata, Bengaluru, Pune, Vadodara and Ahmedabad, silver was priced at Rs 3,050 per 10 grams

Bharat Coking Coal opens at 97% premium: Should you hold or sell BCCL shares?BCCL share price: The stock listed at around a 97% gain over the issue price of Rs 23, reflecting the very high demand seen during the IPO phase.

Trump's Greenland tariff threat rattles global markets, sends dollar lowerGlobal equities softened as investors moved out of risk-heavy assets. Asian and European markets opened lower, while US futures signalled a cautious start.
Sensex tanks over 600 points: 4 reasons why the stock market is down todayA mix of global tension, weak heavyweights, and sustained foreign selling hit investor sentiment right at the open.

Bharat Coking Coal shares make bumper debut. BCCL stock lists at 97% premiumBCCL share price: On the National Stock Exchange, Bharat Coking Coal shares settled at Rs 45, compared with the IPO price of Rs 23. This translates into a gain of about 97% for investors who were allotted shares.

Bullion at a new peak: Why gold and silver prices may continue to riseSilver prices climbed to Rs 299,390 per kg, rising by Rs 11,100 or 3.850%. During the day, silver touched close to the Rs 3 lakh per kg mark, highlighting the strong momentum in the metal.
Sensex opens 340 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 442.24 points to 83,128.11, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 138.00 points to 25,556.35 as of 9:40 am.

entertainment.headline: Amid Dhurandhar 2 buzz, R Madhavan's salt-and-pepper look goes viral. See pics Actor R Madhavan has captured widespread attention with a striking new look after his recent performance in Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar. The second part of the film is set for release on March 19.

Junglee Pictures teams up with Raj Kumar Gupta for new film after success of Haq Junglee Pictures and director Raj Kumar Gupta announce a new collaboration for an ambitious film, with casting soon to begin and high expectations for a powerful, audience-focused narrative.

Border 2 depicts India's crushing response to Pak's Operation Changez Khan: Reports Actor Sunny Deol's upcoming film, Border 2, is reportedly based on India's triple-front response to Pakistan's Operation Changez Khan in 1971. The film is a sequel to the 1997 superhit, Border.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Love And War shifts release to early 2027: Report The release of Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film Love And War has been postponed to 2027 due to the film's large-scale production and overlapping schedules with other major releases.

Dhanush-Kriti's Tere Ishk Mein on OTT amid Rs 84 crore lawsuit. Release details Anand L Rai's 'Tere Ishk Mein' is set for its OTT release. The film features Dhanush and Kriti Sanon in pivotal  characters.

Destiny of Music lies with non-musical people: Shankar Mahadevan backs AR Rahman AR Rahman's recent remarks implying that the Hindi music industry is "communal" sparked widespread backlash. Music composer Shankar Mahadevan now offers a more nuanced take, framing the debate as a divide between creative forces and those who control the industry.

Naagin 7 pulls a GOT–style Red Wedding moment with its Blood Wedding rehash Naagin 7's Blood Wedding sequence drew clear inspiration from Game of Thrones' iconic Red Wedding. Despite differences in scale and intensity, the episode marked a pivotal moment in the show.

Friendship goals: Nayanthara posts candid yacht photos with Trisha Nayanthara's latest Instagram post featuring candid yacht moments with Trisha Krishnan has drawn attention online, fuelling conversation around the duo's long-discussed equation.

Shahid Kapoor's wholesome fan moment proves why he's loved by millions. Watch Shahid Kapoor's recent interaction with a fan has gone viral. The actor is gearing up for the release of his upcoming film 'O'Romeo', which is set for theatrical run on February 13, 2026.

Asin's husband Rahul Sharma calls her 'co-founder' in 10th anniversary note To mark a decade of marriage, Ghajini actor Asin's husband Rahul Sharma shared a heartfelt note on social media. In the note, Rahul called Asin an incredible co-founder and their relationship a high-growth startup.

K-pop supergroup EXO step back into the spotlight with REVERXE K-Pop EXO has returned after two and a half years with their eighth album REVERXE. The album reflects their early mythology while embracing a confident new sound amid lineup changes.

A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms episode 1 review: Westeros, without the traumaRelease Date:Mon Jan 19, 2026 A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms Episode 1 review: HBOs new Game of Thrones spin-off offers a more intimate return to Westeros. Working comfortably as a standalone series, it trades dragons and dread for warmth, simplicity, and emotional depth.

Abhinav Shukla demands resignations of rescue teams after software engineer's death Actor Abhinav Shukla criticised NDRF and government authorities for not being able to rescue Yuvraj Mehra, who died after his car plunged into a water-filled pit in Greater Noida. He alleged that the officials did not take adequate measures in the rescue operation.

Theri re-release postponed again, Vijay vs Ajith box-office face-off off the table he postponement of Jana Nayagan is followed by another setback for Vijay fans, with Theri's re-release delayed once more.

Javed Akhtar says he refused Border 2: What is the need to rewrite songs? Javed Akhtar refused to write lyrics for Border 2. In an exclusive interview, he criticised the trend of reworking old songs and called it a creative bankruptcy. Akhtar urged filmmakers to create new music instead.

ENHYPEN returns with 7th mini-album THE SIN : VANISH | Review ENHYPEN's THE SIN : VANISH album offers a unique vampire-themed audio drama experience. It challenges typical K-pop formats with immersive narration and diverse musical styles.

Ben Affleck's AI take impresses internet: He's actually very intelligent Actor-director Ben Affleck's critical views on artificial intelligence, voiced during a podcast appearance, have triggered significant discussion on social media.
MM Keeravani to present new Vande Mataram composition at Republic Day parade  Composer MM Keeravani and team to compse and perform new version of Vande Mataram at Republic Day parade this year.

Neha Kakkar announces break, requests privacy Singer Neha Kakkar has posted a series of messages on social media indicating she is taking a step back from professional and personal engagements, and has asked fans and media for privacy during this period in new deleted posts.

general news.headline: Noida CEO sacked over techie's death; Yogi Adityanath orders SIT probeNoida Authority CEO M Lokesh was removed days after a 27-year-old techie died when his car fell into a water-filled pit amid dense fog. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered an SIT probe into the incident.

Airport pick-up, hug: PM's rare gesture for UAE President on 2-hour Delhi visitSheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan's short visit to New Delhi marks a significant moment in India-UAE relations. Prime Minister Modi's warm welcome reflects the deepening friendship and expanding cooperation between the two nations.

DGP-level Karnataka cop Ramachandra Rao allegedly caught in intimate act in officeA video showing DGP Ramachandra Rao in compromising acts inside his office has stirred major controversy in Karnataka. The Chief Minister has expressed anger and demanded an explanation while the officer denies the allegations, calling the video morphed.

Video: Scorpio driver knocks down Swiggy rider's bike, then runs him overA Swiggy delivery rider was critically injured in Gurugram after being run over by a Scorpio driver who knocked down his bike. The incident was captured on CCTV. Police have seized the vehicle and identified the driver.

Pak can now achieve purpose of its creation, says Munir. What is he hinting at?Pakistan's Chief of Defence Forces, Asim Munir, said the country was at a juncture where it could achieve the purpose of its creation. He said Pakistan was created in the name of Islam and now enjoyed a special status among Islamic countries.

Don't fuel terrorism in our neighbourhood, Jaishankar tells Polish counterpartIn a blunt message, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski that Warsaw must adopt zero tolerance for terrorism and avoid actions that enable terrorist infrastructure in the region.

Just 1 hour 45 minutes: The rarity of UAE President's meeting with PM ModiThe President of the UAE, Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, is in India for a visit lasting under 2 hours. What makes the visit rare is that it isn't a pit stop, but a full-fledged visit. The meeting comes amid multiple flashpoints and changing equations in the Middle East.

Trump runs global affairs like a mafia boss, says journalist Ishaan TharoorSeated next to Ishaan Tharoor, Financial Times columnist Gideon Rachman chimed in, saying, "With mafia families, you get periods of peace, but eventually they start shooting at each other." Rachman further noted that Trump's entire modus operandi is strikingly reminiscent of how mafia bosses are portrayed in films.

Nawaz Sharif's granddaughter-in-law turns to Sabyasachi, Tarun Tahiliani for her weddingShanzay Ali Rohail's picks for her wedding are making headlines, as Nawaz Sharif's granddaughter-in-law chose outfits from two Indian designers.

2% Irish population are Indians: Ireland assures safety after India Today's reportIn an official response to India Today's article on challenges faced by Indian students in Ireland, the Embassy of Ireland in India reaffirmed that Ireland remains safe, inclusive, and welcoming for Indian students and workers, condemning recent racist incidents while noting the country's high global safety ranking and strong police response.

Javed Akhtar says he refused Border 2: What is the need to rewrite songs?Javed Akhtar refused to write lyrics for Border 2. In an exclusive interview, he criticised the trend of reworking old songs and called it a creative bankruptcy. Akhtar urged filmmakers to create new music instead.

Nitin Nabin elected BJP president, to take charge tomorrow succeeding JP NaddaA total of 37 sets of nomination papers were received, all proposing the name of Nitin Nabin for the top organisational post. With no other candidate in the fray, Nitin Nabin was declared elected unopposed as the BJP national president.

Vegetable seller breaks down as son tells her about CRPF selectionA widely shared Instagram video shows Gopal Sawant from Sindhudurg district telling his mother, a roadside vegetable vendor, about his selection to CRPF.

RBI proposes linking BRICS digital currencies to ease cross-border trade: ReportIf accepted, it would mark the first formal attempt to link the central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) of BRICS members, a move that could reduce dependence on the US dollar at a time of heightened geopolitical tensions.

Rift in Assam BJP? Sarbananda Sonowal busts fake letter claiming Himanta stand-offA fake letter, circulated in the name of Union minister Sarbananda Sonowal calling for a leadership change in the Assam BJP, has been busted by his office. The forged document, which went viral, targeted Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and called for a leadership change ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections.

Rahman Bakait: The maestro fell for bias and baitAR Rahman might just have been baited to say what he did in his latest interview that has sparked off a national controversy. Or, was he led by some sort of bias that crept into him over the years?

Vande Bharat train littered within hours of launch, sparks civic sense outrageThe new Vande Bharat Sleeper Express, connecting Howrah and Guwahati, began operations amid public interest and debate about passenger behavior after a viral video highlighted littering during its inaugural run.
Navarro is wrong, American AI companies not doing any charity in IndiaPeter Navarro says Americans are paying for AI usage in India. That, all evidence suggests, can't be further from the truth.

Why a seat on Trump's Gaza Peace Board could be a landmine for IndiaFor New Delhi, US President Donald Trump's invitation to its much-hyped Gaza Peace Board could be less of an easy opportunity and more of a diplomatic tight-rope walk. Here we tell you why the membership could force India to balance the pull of a Trump-led platform against its long-standing principles and commitments.

Europe shows intent in defending Greenland: UK sends 1 soldier, Finland 2, Norway 2US President Donald Trump's constant threats of annexing Greenland have finally moved Europe to send a military team to the island. Though termed a reconnaissance mission, the commitment of just 37 personnel amid Trump threats might reveal Europe's military seriousness.  Is Europe capable of resisting armed aggression without help from the US?

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 15 | Bhakti: Tamilakam's Epic Counter and Gift to BharatThe Tamil landscape, for centuries, had been shaped by the self-denying, often severe, philosophies of Jainism and Buddhism.

ED seizes DLF Camellias flat, funds worth Rs 54 crore in Gensol Group caseThe ED claims the funds were diverted for other business activities of the Gensol Group and for the personal enrichment of the promoters. The property has therefore been provisionally attached as proceeds of crime under the PMLA.

From ruin to reform: My 12-year real estate nightmare and why RERA is a lifelineA decade-long struggle through stalled projects reveals why strong regulation matters. RERA restored accountability in a sector where delays were normal and buyers carried all the risk.

Yunus upping anti-India game? China envoy to visit Teesta site near Chicken's NeckMonths after torchlight rallies demanding a "fair share" of Teesta waters swept northern Bangladesh, the Chinese ambassador to Dhaka is planning a visit to the river project site near India's sensitive Siliguri Corridor. Framed as development cooperation, the move comes amid stalled India-Bangladesh talks and a sharpening of Dhaka's anti-India posturing under Muhammad Yunus's administration.

sports.headline: Djokovic begins 25th Grand Slam quest with milestone 100th Australian Open victory Novak Djokovic kick-started his quest for a record 25th Grand Slam title by registering his 100th career win at the Australian Open. The Serb defeated Spain's Pedro Martinez in straight sets in the opening round in Melbourne.

Steve Smith accepts T20 World Cup fate, targets LA Olympics 2028 Australia's Steve Smith might have been snubbed from the T20 World Cup squad, but the 36-year-old is not ready to retire from the format yet. Smith has revealed that he wants to play in the LA Olympics, set to be played in 2028.

Virat Kohli still the fittest, he can play ODIs until he is 45: Simon Doull India vs New Zealand: Former New Zealand fast bowler Simon Doull said Virat Kohli has it in him to continue until the age of 45, noting that the India great remains one of the fittest cricketers around. Kohli has scored more than 600 runs in nine matches since returning to action in October 2025.

Pure class: Hon helps injured opponent Stakusic get off court in wheelchair Priscilla Hon showed pure class as she helped her opponent Marina Stakusic leave the court in a wheelchair after getting injured and being forced to retire from their first round clash on Monday, January 19.

Nikhil Naz Slams BCCI Silence After Gautam Gambhir's India Loses Historic ODI Series To New Zealand On this India Today special report, sports journalist Nikhil Naz analyses the crisis in Indian cricket following a historic ODI series defeat against New Zealand. For the first time since 1988, New Zealand has secured a bilateral ODI series win on Indian soil, also marking India's first ever defeat at Indore's Holkar Stadium. Naz highlights that 'it definitely is a Gambhir situation', pointing to the turbulent tenure of head coach Gautam Gambhir, under whom India has now lost three ODI series. The discussion shifts to the perceived inaction of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Naz criticises the board for failing to hold review meetings or address systemic issues, contrasting their silence with the proactive approach of the English Cricket Board. The report questions whether the management and selectors are being held accountable for the team's declining performance across formats ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup.

ICC Issues Ultimatum To Bangladesh Over T20 World Cup Participation In India This report examines the escalating crisis surrounding the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 as Bangladesh faces a potential exit from the tournament. The International Cricket Council (ICC) has reportedly issued a firm ultimatum, stating 'you let us know by Wednesday' if a solution can be reached regarding their participation in India. Bangladesh has expressed reluctance to travel to India, requesting a move to neutral venues or a group swap, both of which the ICC has rejected. The programme highlights that Scotland is on standby as a replacement team. Furthermore, the situation has 'snowballed' with reports that Pakistan may also review its participation if Bangladesh is removed. This marks a historic tension where a team faces complete removal rather than just forfeiting points for individual matches, threatening the integrity of the upcoming global event.

Nikhil Naz Discusses Impact Of Delhi's Toxic Air On India's Global Sporting Image On this Special Report, Sonal Mehrotra Kapoor and Nikhil Naz discuss the alarming impact of air pollution on India's status as a global sporting hub. The discussion follows reports of Danish shuttler Mia Blichfeldt withdrawing from the India Open and paying a heavy fine to avoid Delhi's toxic air. Indian chess grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi is also quoted, stating that 'People are slowly being poisoned in Delhi and nobody seems to care.' The programme highlights how environmental conditions and poor hygiene at venues are deterring international athletes and affecting the training of budding domestic sportspersons. Nikhil Naz points out that while international players voice concerns, Indian athletes often remain silent due to fear of social media trolling or administrative backlash. The report raises critical questions about India's preparedness for major upcoming events like the World Championships and the Olympics.

Australia to do a Travis Head with Cummins at T20 World Cup? Bailey responds Australia's chief selector, George Bailey, has confirmed Pat Cummins will miss the T20 World Cup opener, while Tim David is expected to be fit despite a minor injury setback. Updates on Josh Hazlewood and squad selection deadlines were also provided.

Medvedev says he can beat SinCaraz after winning first Grand Slam match in a year Former world No.1 Daniil Medvedev believes he can still take down Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner after ending a 370-day drought for a Grand Slam victory at the Australian Open.

Malinda Pushpakumara becomes fourth Sri Lankan to take 1,000 first-class wicketsMalinda Pushpakumara entered an exclusive club on Wednesday by becoming only the fourth Sri Lankan cricketer to claim 1,000 wickets in first-class cricket.

Fire still burning for Stan Wawrinka, Daniil Medvedev ends year-long waitAustralian Open 2026: Former champion Stan Wawrinka recovered from a set down to beat Laslo Djere and book his place in the second round. Daniil Medvedev ended a year's wait for a first-round win at a Grand Slam while 37-year-old Marin Cilic power through to the second round.

Nikhil Naz On ICC Ultimatum To Bangladesh Over India-Hosted T20 World CupOn this Special Report, sports editor Nikhil Naz discusses the escalating tension between the International Cricket Council (ICC) and the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB). The ICC has issued a firm ultimatum to Bangladesh, demanding confirmation by Wednesday, January 21, regarding their participation in the T20 World Cup hosted by India. Nikhil Naz notes, 'If you do not confirm your participation, then we will be forced to replace you with another team based on rankings.' The standoff follows the BCB's refusal to travel to India citing security concerns, a situation triggered after the BCCI reportedly requested an IPL franchise to drop Mustafizur Ahmed. While Bangladesh has proposed moving their matches to Sri Lanka or adopting a hybrid model, the ICC has rejected these alternatives. If Bangladesh fails to comply by the deadline, they risk being replaced by Scotland, marking an unprecedented logjam in international cricket history.

Targeting Kuldeep Yadav was part of New Zealand's plan, reveals Daryl MitchellNew Zealand's Indore ODI hero Daryl Mitchell revealed that going after "world-class" spinner Kuldeep Yadav from ball one was a planned move, aimed at preventing the wrist-spinner from settling into a match-controlling rhythm.

Can't eat biryani and win World Champs: Taskmaster Gopichand explains his methodsLegendary shuttler Pullela Gopichand explained why he opts for tough training regimes for his wards, acknowledging that some of his methods have been labelled extreme. The former All England Open champion played a key role in shaping Saina Nehwal and PV Sindhu into world beaters.

Pakistan Super League to switch to IPL-style auction, scrap draft systemThe Pakistan Cricket Board has confirmed sweeping structural reforms to the Pakistan Super League (PSL), with the league set to move from a draft system to a player auction model.

Rohit's hunger questioned after poor show vs New Zealand: 2027 too far awayRohit Sharma's recent poor performance in the ODI series against New Zealand has raised questions about his hunger and future in the Indian team. Former cricketer Simon Doull doubts whether Rohit remains motivated for the 2027 World Cup amid limited upcoming ODI opportunities.

What sets Virat Kohli apart in ODIs? Gavaskar shares a lesson for youngstersIndia vs New Zealand: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has explained what sets Virat Kohli apart in ODIs and urged young batters to take a leaf out of his book to master the art of pacing an innings while chasing stiff targets.

Harshit Rana's biggest critic turns his fan: New Zealand were scared by his hittingIndia vs New Zealand: Former India opener Kris Srikkanth praised Harshit Rana's batting, saying the young all-rounder entertained with his six-hitting in India's defeat to New Zealand in Indore on Sunday, January 18.

After Navi Mumbai, Royal Challengers Bengaluru aim to continue dream run in VadodaraWPL 2026, RCB vs GGW: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have won all four of their matches thus far and are placed at the top of the table while Gujarat Giants will look to bounce back after back-to-back losses.

ICC Issues Ultimatum To Bangladesh Over T20 World Cup Matches In IndiaOn this report, the focus is on the International Cricket Council's (ICC) stern ultimatum to the Bangladesh Cricket Board regarding their participation in the upcoming T20 World Cup matches scheduled in India. Following internal government pressure and security concerns cited by Bangladesh, the ICC has clarified there are no legitimate security threats in India. The global cricket body has reportedly told Bangladesh to 'Play in India or get replaced' in the tournament. A deadline of Wednesday, 21st January, has been set for a final response. The programme discusses the tension between the two boards and the ICC's refusal to move matches, emphasizing that if Bangladesh refuses to travel, they will forfeit their points and be replaced by another team based on current ICC rankings. The report highlights the intersection of sports and politics as the deadline approaches.

No Cummins or Hazlewood as Australia name squad for Pakistan T20I seriesAustralia has rested key fast bowlers Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David for the upcoming Pakistan T20I series. The trio is nursing injuries and are in a race against time to regain fitness ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

ICC tells Bangladesh to play T20 World Cup in India or be replaced: SourcesT20 World Cup 2026: The International Cricket Council has asked the Bangladesh Cricket Board to make a swift decision, making it clear that Bangladesh's request to shift its matches out of India will not be considered. The tournament begins on February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Ironwoman in a man's world: India's Renee Noronha aims to rewrite historyIn an exclusive chat with India Today, India's youngest female Ironman athlete, Renee Noronha, opens up about her world record aspirations and making a positive change for women in endurance sports.

Usain Bolt hints at return from retirement to play cricket at LA 2028 OlympicsUsain Bolt has expressed his desire to compete in cricket at the Los Angeles 2028 Olympics. The sport returns to the Games after 128 years, with Bolt eager to represent Jamaica in this historic comeback.

Rohit-Kohli in Tests, Jadeja in ODIs: Career-killers New Zealand strike againIND vs NZ: New Zealand have once again humbled India in a bilateral series. Last time, they triggered the exit of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma from the Test team. Will this series loss fast-track another set of changes in the Indian team?

Like Nadal on clay: Meet An Se Young, the badminton star impossible to beatWith a win rate touching 95 per cent and a trophy cabinet that has barely shut in 14 months, 23-year-old South Korean An Se-young is breaking her rivals' spirits. After her ruthless defence of the India Open title, the question confronting the sport is simple: how do you stop a player who shows no weaknesses?

Walkout, 94th-minute winner: Senegal snatch AFCON title from MoroccoIn one of the most dramatic finals in recent memory, Senegal staged a walkout and then returned to the field to bear Morocco with a 94th-minute winner to

Shubman Gill defends Rohit's low returns vs NZ: You won't always convert startsIND vs NZ: India captain Shubman Gill defended Rohit Sharma's poor form in the New Zealand ODI series, as India lost by 1-2. Rohit scored 61 runs from three innings and failed to convert his starts.

Already Gambhir's favourite, is it time for India to trust Harshit Rana at No.7?Harshit Rana shone with the bat once again, scoring his maiden fifty against New Zealand during the 3rd ODI in Indore on Sunday, January 18. Can India finally groom Harshit to be their No.7 batter with the ODI World Cup on the horizon?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
